      • getClazz

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getClazz(java.lang.String className)
        Utility method that returns the Class object for the specified class name.
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the Class for which to return the Class object.
        Returns:
        the Class object for the specified class name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • wrapPrimitive

        public static java.lang.Class<?> wrapPrimitive(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        If the specified Class is a primitive, then this function will return the wrapped version. For example, if the specified Class is int.class or Integer.TYPE this method will return Integer.class
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class to wrap
        Returns:
        The specified Class or the wrapped version of the Class if it is a primitive

      • unwrapPrimitive

        public static java.lang.Class<?> unwrapPrimitive(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        If the specified Class is a wrapped primitive, then this function will return the primitive version. For example, if the specified Class is Integer.class this method will return int.class or equivalently, or Integer.TYPE
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class to unwrap
        Returns:
        The specified Class or the primitive version of the Class if it is a wrapped primitive

      • cast

        public static <T> T cast(java.lang.Class<? extends T> clazz,
         java.lang.Object object)
        Casts the specified object to the specified class, taking care of the special case where the specified clazz is a primitive.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class to which to cast the object
        object - The object which to cast to the Class
        Returns:
        The object cast to the specified Class type

      • getPrimitive

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getPrimitive(java.lang.String classname)
        Returns the primitive Class object if the specified class name represents a primitive type; otherwise, returns null
        Parameters:
        classname - The name of the class (or primitive) for which to retrieve the Class
        Returns:
        the primitive Class object if the specified class name represents a primitive type; otherwise, returns null
